result.execSummary:
The defendant Katrina Lynn Willard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) Court assessed only the DNA surcharge with regards to court costs.
2) If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
3) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice.
If the defendant pays the restitution in full, she may petition to discharge off of probation early.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Katrina Lynn Willard

records.addlTxt: Victim restitution ordered
Partial restitution sent

1:08 PM Called 22CM25 for PLEAS.  Defendant Katrina Lynn Willard in court.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Katrina Lynn Willard.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. All appear in person. Attny Otten recites the agreement, withheld sentence, recommendation of 1 year of probation and $2,357 restitution. Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Attny Otten files a PLQ with the court.
Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Court may use the criminal complaint to find probable case. Def understands.  Court asks for plea. 
Def enters a plea of Guilty to count 1, Criminal Damage to Property.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Criminal Damage to Property and orders a JOC, other count DRI.  State confirms in Vic rights compliance.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def does not make a statement to the Court.  
Court Orders: 
Restitution of $2,357
Probation for 1 year with a withheld sentence, if/once restitution paid in full may come off of probation before 1 year mark
Court orders DNA surcharge of $200, but waives court costs.

Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.

9:34 AM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Katrina Lynn Willard appeared by video.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Katrina Lynn Willard.  Case on for Status Conference.  Court notes def was instructed to bring a doctor's note.  Court orders def to come to the Burnett County Government Center and do the drive-thru covid testing this afternoon.  Defense attorney updates the Court: recent contact with def, close to an agreement as to restitution.  Atty Otten requests tentative plea.  Up-front restitution not feasible, would need probation and a payment plan.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on July 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:23 AM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Katrina Lynn Willard in court.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Katrina Lynn Willard. Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: hard to contact def, needs to discuss the discovery.  Def to stay behind after court and talk to her attorney today.  Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on July 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:10 AM Defendant, Katrina Lynn Willard, appeared with Attorney Alysja Otten.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Katrina Lynn Willard appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: contemplating offer and reviewing discovery together.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Def enters NG pleas.  State assures VR compliance.  State requests bond as posted and no contact with the victim.  Def makes a statement.  Court sets bond as posted- $350 cash, with no abusive contact with the victim or their residence.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.
